article:
'Diastole' is the period of time when the heart refills with blood after systole
(contraction). '[[Ventricle (heart)|Ventricular]] diastole' is the period during
which the ventricles are relaxing, while '[[atrium (anatomy)|atrial]] diastole'
is the period during which the atria are relaxing. The term diastole originates
from the Greek word Î´Î¹Î±ÏÏÎ¿Î»Î·, meaning dilation. [http://www.merriam-
webster.com/dictionary/diastole Diastole]. Merriam-Webster Online Dictionary. 24
August 2008.
